Articles.Content:
Well, here's my challange. I have no pics of my launch sadly, so you'll have to take my word for it. I did, however, take pics of my landing.

Gonna be copy-pasting the whole thing from notepad. Yes, you need to use those parts, no others. Yes, multiple of the same parts are okay. Yes, you need to read the points to score yourself. No, least parts does not win. Yes, read the scoring to know to score.

parts

cm mk1

all reg-sized engines

mk16 parachute

communi.

now .22 is out, so use goo instead of large external monoprop. now

all reg-sized fuel tanks

reg-sized srb

reg winglet

reg decoupler

seperatron

rockomax 24-77

rockomax 48-7s

cubical octagonal strut

points

20 per science

10 per crew

+ apoaps above space (70km) in km, no rounding

20 bounus point if achived 80x80 km orbit leeway of 700 meters

if brought communitron can transfer back

if die, and transfered back, you get all points and are entered with -10 for no crew

-5 if no pics, if missing some, 2.5.

-5 points if you do not tally up your own points

tally up own points

ENTRIES

"Why didn't you use the right parts?" (cheaters)

1. SRV Von (-2.5. Included one picture and info of the craft. No science nor crew. 5 allowed parts used.)

2.

3.

4.

5.

Well played, good sir.

1. Johnno 83,413

2. Sesni (20x2=40+10=50+31=81-2.5=79.5)79.5 points

3.

4.

5.

Edited October 16, 2013 by Sesni
Changing stuffs

Coming in for landing

Landed

EDIT : My apoaps was 31 kilometers above space.

Edited October 16, 2013 by Sesni
Can you explain the challenge better? Is this a fewest part count wins kind of thing?
I have understood it, I will take part in it.

Can you explain the challenge better? Is this a fewest part count wins kind of thing?

If so; SSTO. Four parts not counting the six solar panels and four antennas. Weight 0.3 tons in orbit. 1.2 tons on launch.

If so; SSTO. Four parts not counting the six solar panels and four antennas. Weight 0.3 tons in orbit. 1.2 tons on launch.

Uhmmm, why the probe?

Cheaters leaderboard?

Well, first off, adding to post, and second, you need to use parts listed. Also, tally up your own points. I said that already. Also to awnser Blaster, read the points below the allowed parts to see how you get points.

Edited October 15, 2013 by Sesni
lolderp

parts

No struts (EAS-4 Strut Connector) ?

+ apoaps above space (70km) in km, no rounding

Edit: Apoapsis above 70km as pure score? So if I get a 1070km AP I get 1000 points?

if brought communitron can transfer back

If the above then what? Additional points?

Edited October 15, 2013 by Johnno

Seeing as I have to get to bed soon I gave this a really quick whirl, see if rules get updated/explained differently than what I've understood I might do another entry tomorrow.

But for now;

No other parts used than listed in opening post.

1 crew, 10 points. Orbit above 80x80km, 20 points.

Apoapsis above 70km: 83413km (points)

Total score = 83433 points

I said

80x80, and without images of that exact orbit, that sadly cannot be scored. Other than that, you've got 83,413 points.

EDIT : Checked your other post. I mentioned what happens if you transmit back, and the apoaps above space is not all your points.

Edited October 16, 2013 by Sesni
